heading.description: I love the creativity and challenge that goes into building resilient,  maintainable, and secure applications. As our needs and aspirations evolve, I want to be creating software that is capable of evolving with it. I believe this to be true for both UI and for automation.

content.description: I am passionate about helping people and I am working towards this being represented in the problems I am solving. I strongly believe in principles of sustainability and equality of opportunity, and it is equally important to me that people are not just surviving but thriving. Whether it is working in healthcare or personal development; from mental health to the entertainment industry, I am committed to solving problems that are going to bring a benefit to peoples' lives.

heading.description: Whether it is learning a new tech stack, working in a team, or understanding unique and dynamic problems, it is my commitment to architect and build solutions. My experience to-date has been the result of genuine curiosity, interest, and a willingess to learn.

content.description: Currently learning PyTorch to enhance my skills in deep learning and artificial intelligence. My goal is to build a strong foundation in model training and optimization techniques, allowing me to develop and deploy machine learning models efficiently. This aligns with my broader web development experience and my goal of building meaningful applications.

Calm and Connected is an Occupational Therapy provider located in Perth, WA. In this remote work role I have helped uplift the Calm and Connected Camp mobile app and coordinate IT systems used within the company.

Cleaned up UI navigation flow and implemented modals for better UX.**Implemented conditional rendering depending on role and login status.**Added useful error prompts to guide users on validation errors.**Redesigned welcome page by removing ambiguous buttons, resizing images, and adding autoplay to the carousel.**Added in-app browser functionality.

Added new feature that required understanding business logic, authentication, data flow, and creating new UI and a data query.**Enhanced security by implementing access, refresh token, and secure storage best practices.**Optimised stored procedure queries.
Restructuring Google worksuit data management, access and security.**Device management and internal systems security.**Data management for HR.

Designed and implemented an interactive home screen featuring a smooth carousel animation for seamless content browsing.**Developed a vertical reel feature with scrollable content.**Built a join game functionality that allows users to quickly enter active sessions with real-time updates.**Engineered smooth user input handling, including pop-up modals and form validation for an intuitive UX.

Designed and implemented a PostgreSQL database to efficiently store and retrieve user and game data.**Integrated HTTP communication to enable seamless data exchange between the mobile app and backend services.**Developed an interactive and dynamic grid display, allowing users to engage with real-time content updates.

Designed the play screen to support real-time gameplay using WebSockets, enabling instant communication between players and the game server.**Integrated Redis as a channel layer for efficient message delivery and real-time updates.**Utilized Redis queues to store and deliver messages to users when offline, ensuring seamless gameplay experiences upon reconnection.
BHP is a multinational mining company, and I helped develop a platform that was used by the field workers and supervisors to automate and standardise the daily on-site mining operations.

Created UI features including a report logging page and a versions comparison feature.**Created and optimised React Relay queries.**Updated React Relay mutations.**Participated in code reviews and actively sought feedback.**Received an award through Infosys for 'Outstanding Performance'.

Created and optimised Graphene types, resolvers, and GQL queries.**Created and optimised django serializers and queries.**Ran data migrations** Created unit test fixturesets**Refactored features to make them more resuable and maintainable.
At BHP I was also an active member in the Operational Support team, where we maintained the functionality of the production application and liaised with clients.

Debugged and pushed code fixes for production issues.**Investigating logs within the AWS infrastructure.**Analysing Django admin records.**Wrote documentation for the Operational Support team on best practices and debugging techniques for particular features within the platform.

Prioritised the user experience by actively talking to them when they raised production incident tickets, this gave me an appreciation for their issues and the impact it has on their work.**Set up meetings and coordinated the collaborative effort between Dev and Operational Support teams when working through production bugs and feature quality tests.
Infosys is a multinational IT company and for the first three months I successfully completed training courses in C#, Java, SQL, and Angular.
I passed fortnightly exams that assessed our proficiency in the required technologies. Despite already knowing Python the strict OOP and static typing of Java and C# was interesting to learn.
Prior to Infosys, I had taught myself web development through online resources and I quickly became enamoured by Python, JavaScript, CSS, SQL and Git.

Infosys hired me after seeing a small UI project I built that pulled data from a public API (which has since been decommisioned). It's crude, naïve, and honest, and gratefully I have learnt a lot since then.

I have a Bachelor (Honours) degree in Psychology. I want to help people and I find Psychology interesting, though it is not a profession I have decided to pursue. I am now passionate about technology as a way to help others.
At university I developed skills of critical thinking, researching, academic writing and literature review, prioritising assignments, meeting deadlines, and understanding evidence-based principles.

I was awarded a Letter of Commendation for outstanding academic performance after achieving a grade average above 80%, and wrote a dissertation on psychological well-being. The dissertation involved me recruiting and coordinating over 100 participants who volunteered for a week-long data analysis.

heading.description: My expertise lies in leveraging proven technologies to deliver reliable, maintainable, and scalable solutions. Below, I highlight key areas where I've driven impact, using these platforms and tools to achieve meaningful results in real-world projects.

content.description: Built new features**Used tools including MUI, React Relay, and Formik**Improved client-side data validation inspired by user interactions and incident tickets.
Used React, TypeScript, MUI, CSS**Implemented SoC design patterns such as prop rendering**Built unit tests for key operations.

Optimised key server-side functions**Optimised Django and Graphene queries within views, serializers, mutations and resolvers**Built views and RESTful APIs**Wrote, refactored, and debugged throughout the Django ecosystem**Wrote unit tests and fixturesets
Started a Django project from scratch**Ran data and model migrations**Implemented Django Channels with consumers for live client-side updates
Created controller for new feature with business logic**Added in token authentication**Updated routing paths
Optimised server-side functionality and cached tables that were read often and infrequently updated.
Configured production hosting**Implemented async queues for offline play functionality in conjunction with Websocket updates**Implemented channel layers with Django
Optimised stored procedures**Migrated a database dump**Updated virtual tables/ views
Created new databases**Created new database users with assigned roles**Debugged using CLI
I have built a React Native mobile app with Expo, using libraries like reanimated for an infinite carousel slider
On the Calm and Connected Camp App I have created new features and implemented uplifts. This involved adding in new components, updating templates, and changing navigation logic for improved UX.
Our team practiced agile methodology in which I participated in daily scrums, sprint planning, sprint retrospection, and backlog grooming on Jira tickets.
As a developer I made a regular practice of managing feature branches, rebasing, and resolving merge conflicts.
I participated in code reviews and approving pull requests, while actively taking on any feedback and advice in how to improve the quality of my code.
I followed BHP's lead and build Pre-Commit into my projects workflow to automate and enforce quality styling standards.
I have added Sentry logs into the TB mobile app for real-time error reporting and debugging.
I collaboratively deployed hot fixes for production following feature releases, learning the full pipeline including build stages, testing, infrastructure configuration, and deployment.
Within this Web Resume project I automated unit test execution and pushed docker images to a registery, making use of the projects docker-compose container configuration.
Exploring CI/CD options and GitHub Actions exposed me to the many server, infrastructure and deployment configurations for different applications and scaling requirements.

Having learnt the AWS infrastructure that BHP used for their project I decided to replicate it for this web resume. I have since moved to a Linux VPS, but I had successfully deployed to AWS and made use of its scalability features.
Successfully deploying to AWS involved using; ECR, Fargate, ECS, ALB, Security Group, VPC endpoints, Parameter Store Secrets, IAM, RDS, CloudWatch.
I have used multi-stage builds for the docker images, docker-compose for network and volume orchestration, and I am looking to implement Kubernetes for production container management.
Managing dependencies gave me greater exposure to the Linux file structure and its executables.
Leveraging package managers was cool but understanding the security and functional dynamics of dependencies was really interesting.
If you have a proposal, idea, feedback, or just want to say hi, I would love to hear from you!

heading.description: As a passionate problem-solver with a background in IT and web development, I enjoy challenges and new experiences. Whether it is moving to Europe or training in Brazilian Jiu Jitsu, I love the diversity, learning, and building that comes with the journey.

content.description: I was born in Perth, Western Australia, and for the past year I have been living in the Netherlands. At 27 years old I wanted a challenge and to experience life in a different country. I love the excitement and culture of Europe, there is always something new and dynamic to experience, and having met so many unique and amazing people I am now looking to build a life here. Although I prefer catching up with people and working from a company building, the flexibility of a remote position to become immersed in other parts of Europe is something I am interested in.

In my spare time you will find me at a Brazilian Jiu Jitsu gym, which is a grappling based martial art that I have been training in for the past four years. There are so many things I love about this sport, exercise, people, friends, and an infinite number of techniques and positions to learn. It is inspiring seeing myself and the people around me go from utter newbies who have no clue on what is going on to becoming adept and skilled in a difficult and stressful situation like fighting. At my local gym there is a massive quote sitting above a board of competition medals, “Surround yourself with people who make you a better person”, and I take that attitude with me everywhere I go.
